poem:
Title: Of Post and Pennies Saved

The Mail, like oft-used plums in ice,
Since Saturday's use becomes so slight.
So much in pounds could be our delight,
From six days hence, a three-day splice.
A £650 mirage, appears so nice,
Upon the Ofcom watchdog's sight.
Much like plums' sweetness in the night,
The promise of savings entice.
In unbounded brevity all is concise.
